meanings.definition: Altering or manipulating in a deceptive way
meanings.sent1: The fudging salesperson made false promises to customers.
meanings.sent2: She gave a fudging answer to avoid admitting the mistake.
meanings.sent3: The fudging magician pretended to pull a rabbit out of an empty hat.
meanings.sent4: His fudging smile hid his true feelings of disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The fudging disguise fooled everyone at the party.

meanings.definition: Using euphemistic language to avoid telling the truth
meanings.sent1: The fudging politician carefully chose his words to mislead the public.
meanings.sent2: She used fudging phrases to soften the impact of her criticism.
meanings.sent3: The fudging excuse for being late was that the traffic was unusually heavy.
meanings.sent4: Her fudging apology seemed insincere to those who knew the truth.
meanings.sent5: The fudging explanation confused rather than clarified the situation.

meanings.definition: Making minor changes or adjustments to something
meanings.sent1: He was fudging the numbers to make the report look better.
meanings.sent2: She was fudging the details of her story to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent3: The chef was fudging the recipe by adding a pinch of extra spice.
meanings.sent4: The artist was fudging the painting by blending different colors together.
meanings.sent5: The student was fudging the margins to fit more text on the page.

meanings.definition: Acting in a dishonest or deceitful manner
meanings.sent1: The fudging contractor overcharged for the repairs.
meanings.sent2: He had a fudging smile that made others suspicious of his intentions.
meanings.sent3: The fudging fox tried to trick the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her fudging behavior at work eventually caught up with her.
meanings.sent5: The fudging character in the movie was always up to no good.
